description: I am an award-winning retired History teacher who also taught French, Spanish and German. I love telling people about events from the past which affect us today. I have led several historical bike tours for members of Toronto Bike Meetup in the past 3 years, and got super positive feedback for them. That inspired me to lead unique and unconventional bicycle tours to the more interesting and lesser known historical sites in the city. I call it History in Motion.

reviews.title: Awesome Combo of Biking and History
text: Wow, this tour was fantastic! Sean was friendly, knowledgeable, funny, and clearly passionate about the city and its history. You can really see his history teacher skills at work on this tour as he makes history come alive in creative and unexpected ways. The route is carefully chosen with lots of interesting stops. Plus the whole ride is on a safe set of trails that are pleasurable and easy to explore. Overall, we had a wonderful time and I can strongly recommend to tourists and locals alike. Enjoy!!

reviews.title: Great Toronto bike tour for locals and globals!
text: My husband, son and I went on the Toronto bike tour with History in Motion in the spring. We absolutely loved it (despite the poor weather). Sean was super enthusiastic and very knowledgeable about so much Toronto history. I used to live in Toronto and learned SO much about the city that I never knew before. The stories he told, like the one about Ned Hanlan, were really engaging. Sean was really well organized and always attentive to how everyone in the group was doing, including my son who had a flat tire :( Overall, a terrific experience and we would highly recommend History in Motion for anyone visiting Toronto.

reviews.title: It was a fantastic experience!
text: Thanks to Sean, we had a great biking experience and learned a lot of history and information about Toronto!😊
It was fun to bike in the summer time in Toronto which is cool and sunny!🌞🌻🌼🌸🐦🦆🦢🐥🌳 🐕🐿🦋
Will definitely recommend you to get a bike tour with Sean!😁😁😁😁😊😊😊😊😍😍😍😍

reviews.title: Fascinating and Fun
text: Sean took us to some really interesting spots I would never have found on my own, and provided some great historical background about the sights and places. Most of our ride was along the waterfront which was really pleasant. Nice, relaxed pace. A lot of fun, I definitely recommend it, and would go again.

reviews.title: Interesting facts about Toronto
text: What a great trip! I learned so much, even though I was born and raised in Toronto. Sean made history come to life. It was very interesting and I learned a few new facts about Toronto and feel like I know Toronto much better now. Sean was a great host because he made me feel comfortable on the tour: he is friendly and open. It's clear that he takes pride in the city, especially its history along the waterfront. It was a very unique tour, one that included healthy snacks.

reviews.title: Historical experience
text: トロントの湾岸エリアを巡りながら、歴史的な説明をしてくれるツアーです。英語、仏語、スペイン語に対応してくれます。日本語はありませんが、平易な英語で説明してくれるので解りやすかったです。自転車は事前に参加者の身長を伝えておくとそれに合った物を用意してくれます。
道は殆ど平坦な歩道を走ります。ツアーガイドは元教師なのでいろいろ聞いても説明してくれます。
普通の自転車ツアーでは物足りない人、歴史に興味のある人には良いツアーだと思います。

We biked short tour around waterfront of Toronto. Tour guide is a so nice guy. He was kind, polite and friendly. He took us historical monuments, seaside, small airport and a park. He explained interesting history about those plases.
The course is almast flat and he adjusted riding speed for my kids.
He had short brake and bring us snacks.
I recommend this tour, if you like history and want to unusual bike tour!
I suggest bring water bottle if you join it.

reviews.title: Fun and informative
text: The bike ride was exhilarating! Sean was charismatic, organized and super knowledgeable about the history of Toronto. I would recommend this tour to locals and tourists alike. I live near where we biked and still learned a lot about my area, making me appreciate living by the waterfront even more. I'd love to do this tour again as there was so much information I couldn't retain it all. Overall, a fun, enjoyable learning experience with surprises to boot! Sean, thank you for being so adaptable to the weather and my technical difficulties. :)

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing! Unique!
text: This was a fantastic and wonderful trip! We learned so much! Sean knows a lot about the history of Toronto. He made history come alive. These were not the typical tourist destinations: the route was very unique. We learned about some places even locals don’t know about: the hidden gems in the city. His website is also helpful: HistoryinMotion dot ca

reviews.title: Fantastic tour
text: I had a great time on Sean's bike tour. He made the history of Toronto very interesting and I learned a lot. There were some places I had never been to, even though I have lived in this city forever. Sean led us along the waterfront, which was very scenic in a very friendly way. I hope to go back there again soon.

reviews.title: Fabulous Tour!
text: I was visiting the city with friends and we really wanted to see the city on bike. We have an interest in any city’s past, so the idea of history in motion was intriguing. We had a great time! Sean is informed and passionate about the city and led us through areas we would have otherwise overlooked.

You will find other bike tours but if you want one that gives you a true feel for the story of Toronto, this is it!  Sean was good company, sensitive to our needs and also gave us some great ideas for the balance of our stay.  Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Fantastic Tour of the Toronto Waterfront
text: Great way to see the Toronto Waterfront and get a history lesson at the same time!  Sean's passion for the history of the city made the tour truly memorable.  He also gave us a great restaurant recommendation in the Distillery District.

reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic
text: This was a truly excellent tour of Toronto. Sean is not only a great cycle guide but, as a history teacher, he knows how to make the city come alive. We visited parts of TO we had never seen before and Sean knows every detail of this great city. Sean can match the biking experience to the physical level of the participants.  It was one of the highlights of our trip to Toronto and we will book another trip with him the next time we are in town. We give Sean our highest recommendation!!

reviews.title: Fantastic Choice!
text: Sean was great on this guided tour of the city of Toronto. We were traveling with our 13 year old son, and Sean's background as a history teacher really helped in his detailed descriptions of Toronto's rich history. This was our first activity on our trip, and we are really glad we chose this tour. Without a doubt, I'd recommend this to anyone headed to Toronto. Sean is from there and lives there, which is evident from his level of passion in sharing his beautiful city!

reviews.title: A fun, interactive experience along the waterfront area of Toronto
text: This was our first time visiting Toronto. We couldn’t have been happier with our choice of allowing Sean to show us his city through the eyes of a historian. His wealth of knowledge, combined with a friendly and caring manner were a winning combination. The bikes were very comfortable and the pace easy and relaxed. We had so much fun! Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Excellent historical tour
text: Sean's historical bike tour was extraordinary. He has in-depth knowledge of the city and he communicated his knowledge with clarity and wit. Furthermore, he knew the answers to every question our group asked!
The pace of cycling was easy, and the bike paths were mostly flat. So this is a good excursion for anyone who doesn't normally do a lot of biking.

I have lived in Toronto most of my life and think I know the city pretty well. Yet Sean managed to take me places I didn't know existed, and to places I knew about but had never visited. (My favourite was the little zoo in High Park. I had never seen a bison before!)
I recently visited London England, and went on several historical walking tours, which were uniformly excellent. The quality of Sean's historical tour was their equal.
Sean brings the history of Toronto alive. Very highly recommended.
